title.narrative: OECS E-Government for Regional Integration Program (APL)

description.narrative: The overall development objective of the project is to promote the efficiency, quality, and transparency of public services through the delivery of regionally integrated e-government applications that apply economies of scale.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

title.narrative: Completion of e-government service upgrades to the Public Financial Management System, as well as interfaces with other systems

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Completion of e-government service upgradestothe Public Financial Management System, as well as interfaces with other systems and web-based public information system"

title.narrative: Implementation of a tax e-filing front end system for SIGTAS.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Completion of e-government service upgradestothe e-taxation system as well as interfaces with other systems and web-based tax filing system"
Every country will be awarded one point for each web-based front end system implemented giving a total of 4.

title.narrative: Definition and publication of regional e-government standards, enterprise architecture, interoperability framework and total cost of ownership documents by the OECS Secretariat

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Definition and publication of regionale-government standards and total cost of ownership framework"

title.narrative: Detailed design and implementation of a Multi-Purpose ID system in at least one core user agency, including issuance of ID numbers

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Detailed design and implementation of IDsystem in core user agencies, including issuance of ID numbers and cards"
One point will be awarded for each country (giving a total of four) that has successfully implemented a multi-purpose ID system inone (or more) core agency.
Detailed design for multi-purpose ID System has been completed.

title.narrative: Average number of days to prepare annual budget

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Estimated user's time and cost savingsmeasured through standardized methodology for representative transactions"

title.narrative: Reduction in the costs of pharmaceuticals procured

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Financial savings due to new system"
The specific "basket" of pharmaceuticals will be defined at the time of system implementation, as it is dependent on theprocurement cycle needs at that time

title.narrative: Implementation of a Regional Customs Information System (RCIS) with interface to ASYCUDA World.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Implementation of a Regional e-Customs Systemas well as interfaces with other systems and web-based customs filing system"

title.narrative: Implementation of a regional OECS Pharmaceutical Procurement Service E-tendering System.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Implementation of an e-procurement system inall OECS countries"

title.narrative: Publication of OECS e-government regionally harmonized legislation by first quarter 2012 approved by the OECS Authority

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Implementation of key institutional and ITrequirements for priority aspects of a regionally harmonized e-government regulatory framework"
The OECS Authority - the body of Prime Ministers for the OECS member countries

title.narrative: Creation of four national PFM websites with open and transparent PFM data sets.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Improvement of ratings in areas of opennessand access to relevant information, as reported by users through satisfaction" surveys
One point given for each country with a PFM website with at least one transparent dataset.

title.narrative: Quality measured through focus groups by end users of the following three systems: Public Financial Management System; Regional Customs Information System; and Multipurpose ID Systems

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Improvement of ratings in areas offunctionality accuracy and usability of e-government services by users through satisfaction surveys"
At project completion, implementation of focus group questionnaire to be designed by M&E consultant under REGU

title.narrative: Number of new e-government applications offered or upgraded under the project.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Increase in e-government services offered orupgraded"

12 Country Systems, in turn composed of4 Multipurpose ID Systems (MPID);4 Public Financial Management Systems (PFM); and4Front-end e-tax systems.In addition, it is composed of 3 Regional Systems:1 Regional Health Management Information System;(RHMIS);1 Regional Customs Information System (RCIS); and1 OECS Pharmaceutical Procurement Service E-tendering System.

title.narrative: Regional Health Information System and Regional Customs Information System are installed and operational.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Increase in number of electronic transactionsprocessed by regional e-government applications"

title.narrative: Total number of goods declarations shared through the RCIS among countries.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Increase in the volume of transactions ofregional e-customs system"
Target is a 10% increase.Total number of Goods Declarations for current reporting period – total number of Goods Declarations forlast reporting period.[(f/p)-1]x100

title.narrative: Increase in the volume of transactions of OECS Pharmaceutical Procurement Service E-tendering System.

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Increase in the volume of transactions ofregional e-procurement system"
Target is 10% increase in number of transactions

title.narrative: Tax declarations filed online through the tax e-filing system as a % of total Tax declarations filed (VAT).

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Increase in volume of transactions ofe-taxation system"
10% increase is targeted.Number of online VAT over total VAT declarations.

title.narrative: Establishment of Regional E-government Desk at OECS Secretariat, hiring of the Senior E-Government Specialist, design of Business Plan for sustainability of Regional E-Government Desk are completed

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "New regional institutional framework iscreated with adequate capacity to provide new regionally integrated e-government services in accordance with regionally harmonizedpolicies andregulations"
One point given for each indicator criterion met:•E-government desk creation staffed with e-government specialist•Business planfor sustainability completed
Business Plan for sustainability completed

title.narrative: Percentage of regional population covered in the multi-purpose ID system

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Percentage of regional population covered ine-ID system"
Total number of persons captured in all country multi-purpose ID systems over combined population of all countries x100.

title.narrative: Regional consensus by OECS countries on a CARICOM E-government strategy, to which OECS countries have contributed, is reached through OECS country agreement to the strategy reports at CARICOM meetings

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Publication of outcome-orientedregionally-focused e-government strategy implementation plans for OECS countries"
Countries agreement to recognize CARICOM e-government strategy
Consensus on a regionally-focused e-government strategy developed by CARICAD and/or a digital Strategy developed CARICOM.

title.narrative: Regional Consensus by EGRIP countries on the approval of the new institutional framework is reached at an EGRIP meeting

comment.narrative: Indicator modified in restructured M&E framework approved in April 2012. Before was "Regional agreement for new institutionalframework is reached financing is provided, staff is hired and trained

title.narrative: Increase in volume of transactions of a regional health management information system (# of transactions)

comment.narrative: 10% increase in number of transactions

title.narrative: Implementation of a Regional Health Management Information System

comment.narrative: Conceptual Design for the Regional Health Management Information System completed.
